wg:property.wg:name: Angle
wg:property.wg:description: Clockwise rotation angle in degrees

wg:property.wg:name: Scale factor
wg:property.wg:description: Scale factor

wg:property.wg:name: Angle
wg:property.wg:description: Clockwise rotation angle in degrees

wg:property.wg:name: Scale factor
wg:property.wg:description: Scale factor

wg:property.wg:name: Inertia
wg:property.wg:description: Conservation of node speed at each new pass

wg:property.wg:name: Repulsion strength
wg:property.wg:description: How strongly does each node reject others

wg:property.wg:name: Attraction strength
wg:property.wg:description: How strongly does each pair of connected nodes attract each other

wg:property.wg:name: Maximum displacement
wg:property.wg:description: This is limiting each node's displacement (to prevent some super-rejecting when nodes are too close)

wg:property.wg:name: Auto stabilize function
wg:property.wg:description: Activates the freezing of unstable nodes. Despite some loss of efficiency, this prevents most of nodes flickering

wg:property.wg:name: Autostab Strength
wg:property.wg:description: Power of the auto stabilize function

wg:property.wg:name: Autostab sensibility
wg:property.wg:description: [0,1] This parameters represents the auto-adaptiveness of the anti-flickering function (actually, the freezing inertia)

wg:property.wg:name: Gravity
wg:property.wg:description: This force attracts all nodes to the center to avoid dispersion of disconnected components

wg:property.wg:name: Attraction Distrib.
wg:property.wg:description: The attractive force is distributed along outbound links. This tends to push hubs at the periphery and put authorities more central

wg:property.wg:name: Adjust by Sizes
wg:property.wg:description: Avoid nodes overlapping (depending from the size of each node)

wg:property.wg:name: Speed
wg:property.wg:description: Value > 0 default 1 ; permits you to increase convergence speed at the price of a precision loss

wg:property.wg:name: Scaling
wg:property.wg:description: How much repulsion you want. More makes a more sparse graph.

wg:property.wg:name: Stronger Gravity
wg:property.wg:description: A stronger gravity law

wg:property.wg:name: Gravity
wg:property.wg:description: Attracts nodes to the center. Prevents islands from drifting away.

wg:property.wg:name: Dissuade Hubs
wg:property.wg:description: Distributes attraction along outbound edges. Hubs attract less and thus are pushed to the borders.

wg:property.wg:name: LinLog mode
wg:property.wg:description: Switch ForceAtlas' model from lin-lin to lin-log (tribute to Andreas Noack). Makes clusters more tight.

wg:property.wg:name: Prevent Overlap
wg:property.wg:description: Use only when spatialized. Should not be used with "Approximate Repulsion"

wg:property.wg:name: Edge Weight Influence
wg:property.wg:description: How much influence you give to the edges weight. 0 is "no influence" and 1 is "normal".

wg:property.wg:name: Tolerance (speed)
wg:property.wg:description: How much swinging you allow. Above 1 discouraged. Lower gives less speed and more precision.

wg:property.wg:name: Approximate Repulsion
wg:property.wg:description: Barnes Hut optimization: nÂ² complexity to n.ln(n) ; allows larger graphs.

wg:property.wg:name: Approximation
wg:property.wg:description: Theta of the Barnes Hut optimization.

wg:property.wg:name: Threads number
wg:property.wg:description: More threads means more speed if your cores can handle it.

wg:property.wg:name: Area
wg:property.wg:description: The graph size area, for example 1000 for 100 nodes.

wg:property.wg:name: Gravity
wg:property.wg:description: This force attracts all nodes to the center to avoid dispersion of disconnected components.

wg:property.wg:name: Speed
wg:property.wg:description: Value > 0 default 1 ; increase convergence speed at the price of a precision loss.

wg:property.wg:name: Speed
wg:property.wg:description: Speed factor

wg:property.wg:name: Include Node size
wg:property.wg:description: Include node size in repulsion

wg:property.wg:name: Attribute
wg:property.wg:description: select attribute with distance value

wg:property.wg:name: Layer Distance
wg:property.wg:description: Distance between each layer

wg:property.wg:name: Adjust
wg:property.wg:description: Adjust by size

wg:property.wg:name: Space size
wg:property.wg:description: The size of the space to randomly distribute the nodes.

wg:property.wg:name: Optimal Distance
wg:property.wg:description: The natural length of the springs. Bigger values mean nodes will be farther apart.

wg:property.wg:name: Relative Strength
wg:property.wg:description: The relative strength between electrical force (repulsion) and spring force (attraction).

wg:property.wg:name: Initial Step size
wg:property.wg:description: The initial step size used in the integration phase. Set this value to a meaningful size compared to the optimal distance (10% is a good starting point).

wg:property.wg:name: Step ratio
wg:property.wg:description: The ratio used to update the step size across iterations.

wg:property.wg:name: Adaptive Cooling
wg:property.wg:description: Controls the use of adaptive cooling. It is used help the layout algoritm to avoid energy local minima.

wg:property.wg:name: Convergence Threshold
wg:property.wg:description: Relative energy convergence threshold. Smaller values mean more accuracy.

wg:property.wg:name: Quadtree Max Level
wg:property.wg:description: The maximun level to be used in the quadtree representation. Greater values mean more accuracy.

wg:property.wg:name: Theta
wg:property.wg:description: The theta parameter for Barnes-Hut opening criteria. Smaller values mean more accuracy.

wg:property.wg:name: Optimal Distance
wg:property.wg:description: The natural length of the springs. Bigger values mean nodes will be farther apart.

wg:property.wg:name: Relative Strength
wg:property.wg:description: The relative strength between electrical force (repulsion) and spring force (attraction).

wg:property.wg:name: Initial Step size
wg:property.wg:description: The initial step size used in the integration phase. Set this value to a meaningful size compared to the optimal distance (10% is a good starting point).

wg:property.wg:name: Step ratio
wg:property.wg:description: The ratio used to update the step size across iterations.

wg:property.wg:name: Adaptive Cooling
wg:property.wg:description: Controls the use of adaptive cooling. It is used help the layout algoritm to avoid energy local minima.

wg:property.wg:name: Convergence Threshold
wg:property.wg:description: Relative energy convergence threshold. Smaller values mean more accuracy.

wg:property.wg:name: Quadtree Max Level
wg:property.wg:description: The maximun level to be used in the quadtree representation. Greater values mean more accuracy.

wg:property.wg:name: Theta
wg:property.wg:description: The theta parameter for Barnes-Hut opening criteria. Smaller values mean more accuracy.

wg:property.wg:name: Minimum level size
wg:property.wg:description: The minimum amount of nodes every level must have (bigger values mean less levels)

wg:property.wg:name: Minimum coarsening rate
wg:property.wg:description: The minimum relative size between two levels (smaller values mean less levels)

wg:property.wg:name: Step ratio
wg:property.wg:description: The ratio used to update the step size across iterations.

wg:property.wg:name: Optimal Distance
wg:property.wg:description: The natural length of the springs. Bigger values mean nodes will be farther apart.

wg:property.wg:name: Quadtree Max Level
wg:property.wg:description: The maximun level to be used in the quadtree representation. Greater values mean more accuracy.

wg:property.wg:name: Theta
wg:property.wg:description: The theta parameter for Barnes-Hut opening criteria. Smaller values mean more accuracy.
